greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Card{(x,y,z,t): 1<=x,y,z,t<=n, gcd(x,y,z,t)=1, lcm(x,y,z,t)=n}.
comment: For given n and k positive integers, let L(n,k) represent the number of ordered k-tuples of positive integers, whose GCD is 1 and LCM is n. In this notation, the sequence corresponds to a(n) = L(n,4).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000

O. Bagdasar, On Some Functions Involving the lcm and gcd of Integer Tuples, Scientific publications of the state university of Novi Pazar, Ser. A: Appl. Maths. Inform. and Mech., Vol. 6, 2 (2014), 91-100.
formula: For n = p_1^{n_1} p_2^{n_2}...p_r^{n_r} one has
results.author: _Ovidiu Bagdasar_, Sep 18 2014
